#Text=Decorate a Basement Apartment
#Text=A basement apartment is often an affordable way to live in the city , but what you get in location you pay for with space and natural light .
#Text=While many people find basement apartments charming , they can also be small , dark and because they are underground , a little claustrophobic .
#Text=Decorate a basement apartment by focusing on light , color and the appropriate placement of furniture .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Using the Right Materials
#Text=Determine humidity control factors .
#Text=Basements in some regions often have little air flow and high humidity .
#Text=If your apartment has central heat and air and relatively good return , you have all options for materials .
#Text=If humidity and little air flow are issues , consider using humidity-resistant , or rust , mildew resistant materials .
#Text=Basement Apartment Lighting
#Text=Place artificial light sources around the apartment .
#Text=You will have little , if any , natural light , so take advantage of artificial light where you can .
#Text=Use lamps .
#Text=This will provide softer light than harsh overhead lighting .
#Text=They will also keep your place looking larger since light that is too bright can make a space look smaller .
#Text=Take advantage of different lamp sizes and wattages .
#Text=Use floor lamps in corners with brighter bulbs and smaller lamps on tables and surfaces with dim bulbs .
#Text=Include track lighting .
#Text=The contrast in track lighting and lamps will give your basement apartment a mood that reflects its cozy appeal and urban location .
#Text=Keep windows accessible if you do have them .
#Text=Open blinds or curtains during the day will allow a bit of natural light .
#Text=Maximize light in your kitchen area .
#Text=Whether you have a kitchenette , a full kitchen or a microwave and a mini fridge , you will want to be able to see everything you are doing in the kitchen .
#Text=Using Color
#Text=Mix light and bright colors on your basement apartment walls .
#Text=Use dark splashes of color on wall sections if the majority of your walls are kept white .
#Text=Paint walls bright colors such as burgundy , green or chocolate brown and complement those colors with lighter furnishings or light trim .
#Text=Choose different paint colors to separate your living spaces .
#Text=For example , paint the living room area brown and your bedroom or sleeping area light blue .
#Text=Take advantage of color , texture and patterns in other places .
#Text=You can utilize color with your furnishings , accessories and carpets as well as your walls .
#Text=Select throw rugs that contrast with your carpet or walls .
#Text=For example , a bright red rug against a white or beige floor will really get attention .
#Text=Utilize drapes and window treatments .
#Text=A dark set of curtains or drapes against a light wall can create a beautiful , well put together effect .
#Text=Include mirrors .
#Text=Not only will mirrors make your basement apartment look bigger , they will reflect the colors you have in your place .
#Text=Placing Furniture
#Text=Do a little space planning before you move in .
#Text=Measure the rooms and decide if your current furniture will fit , or if you will have to acquire new pieces .
#Text=Create separate living areas .
#Text=This is especially important if you have one large living space instead of a separate bedroom , kitchen and living room , place .
#Text=Use your furniture to divide up the area .
#Text=Use furniture that has multiple uses .
#Text=This will save you space .
#Text=For example , use ottomans or benches that open up and provide storage or a bed with drawers underneath .
#Text=Allow for empty space .
#Text=There is no need to have a piece of furniture in every empty spot .
#Text=Utilize corners .
#Text=Put a chair in a corner to create a reading space or get a desk that fits a corner so you have a work area .
#Text=Keep clutter out of your basement apartment .
#Text=Use all of your available storage and if necessary , borrow space in a friend 's basement , attic or spare room to keep whatever you cannot fit .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Work with an interior designer if you have the budget .
#Text=If you cannot afford a professional , see if a college student or design intern would be willing to help you decorate your basement apartment to earn the experience and hands-on training .
